Advanced_Ship_NoticeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Advanced_Ship_NoticeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Advanced_Ship_NoticeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Request_References.description: References to existing Advanced Ship Notices to be retrieved via the Get Advanced Ship Notices Web Service operation

description: Element that contains references to existing Advanced Ship Notices to be retrieved.  This is mutually exclusive with the Request Criteria element.

CompanyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CompanyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CompanyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to an existing Company or Company Hierarchy

Resource_ProviderObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Resource_ProviderObjectID.type: WID,  Contingent_Worker_ID,  External_Sourceable_ID,  Internal_Service_Provider_ID,  Internal_Service_Provider_Reference_ID,  Supplier_ID,  Supplier_Reference_ID
Resource_ProviderObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Resource_ProviderObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Purchase_OrderObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Purchase_OrderObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
For types that require a parent reference, contains a unique identifier for an instance of a parent object.
For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Purchase_OrderObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Request_Criteria.description: Shipment Date Time On or After
Shipment Date Time On or Before

description: Element containing criteria used to retrieve Advanced Ship Notices.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Response_Group.description: Indicates whether attachments should be included when retrieving Advanced Ship Notices.

description: Element containing the Advanced Ship Notice response group.
